p: Alginate is an acidic anionic polysaccharide and able to form covalent bonds and charge-charge electrostatic complexes with protein [ 218, 219]. Especially following heat denaturation of the protein, stronger interactions are formed [ 218, 219]. Studies on alginate-protein interactions and other investigations on alginate-based edible coatings and films (without their application on food products) are presented in Table 5.
